SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
IN-APP GUIDANCE
Permissions for Creating and Accessing In-App Guidance

A Salesforce admin assigns permissions to users who create in-app guidance in any environment, who access walkthroughs in Lightning Experience, and who access in-app guidance in Experience Cloud sites. No permissions are necessary for accessing prompts in Lightning Experience.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Essentials, Group, Professional, Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions
Available with Enablement, which is available with Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, or Salesforce Platform for an additional cost in: Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer Editions
In-app guidance in Experience Cloud sites with Partner Enablement requires an Enablement add-on license and supported PRM add-on license.
Permissions, Permission Sets, and Permission Set Licenses

These permissions are available and included in default permission sets.

TASK	USER TYPE	PERMISSION NEEDED	DEFAULT PERMISSION SET	PERMISSION SET LICENSE
Create prompts or walkthroughs in Lightning Experience	Salesforce admin	Modify All Data or Customize Application	None	None
Non-admin user	Design and Deliver In-App Guidance	Manage In-App Guidance	Enablement Resources
Take walkthroughs in Lightning Experience	Any user	Take Custom Walkthroughs	Use Custom Walkthroughs	Walkthroughs
Take prompts in Lightning Experience	Any user	None	None	None
Create prompts or walkthroughs in Experience Cloud sites	Salesforce admin	Modify All Data or Customize Application	None	None
Non-admin user	Design and Deliver In-App Guidance for Partners	Manage In-App Guidance for Partners	Enablement Resources
Take prompts and walkthroughs in Experience Cloud sites	Partner user	Take In-App Guidance for Partners	Use In-App Guidance for Partners	Walkthroughs

Most of these permission sets are also included in Enablement permission set groups.

Other Required Permissions for Creating In-App Guidance

The Manage In-App Guidance and Manage In-App Guidance for Partners permission sets also include these related system permissions.

View All Profiles
View Roles and Role Hierarchy
View Setup and Configuration

In Lightning Experience, if in-app guidance is related to a specific object or app, you also need access to that item. Otherwise, some actions aren’t available in In-App Guidance Builder.

Other Requirements for Experience Cloud Sites

Extra permissions are required for selecting a site from the Environment dropdown in In-App Guidance Builder.

YOUR PERMISSION OR ACCESS	SITES YOU CAN SELECT
Create and Set Up Experiences	Inactive or active sites
Customize Application	Inactive or active sites
Member of the site	Active sites only

If you don’t have one of these permissions, you can’t see the site in In-App Guidance Builder. If another user with these permissions created in-app guidance in a site and you try to edit the in-app guidance they created, you can’t see the site.

Free Walkthroughs in Lightning Experience

In Lightning Experience, you can create and activate up to three free custom walkthroughs. To activate more than three custom walkthroughs at a time, purchase the Enablement add-on license and assign permissions.

To activate more than three custom walkthroughs at a time, purchase the Enablement add-on license and assign the Use Custom Walkthroughs permission set to selected users. However, after you purchase the license, only users with this permission set can view any custom walkthroughs. The three free custom walkthroughs are no longer available to all users. The In-App Guidance page in Setup shows the number of free custom walkthroughs that remain available.

In supported Experience Cloud sites, all walkthroughs require Enablement and PRM licenses.
